title: Sales & Marketing Intern
description:
About AL HAWA GROUP OF COMPANIES

About Al Hawa Information Technology Services Company

Al Hawa Technologies is a dynamic and forward-thinking information technology company providing a comprehensive range of professional services, including custom software development, database design and implementation, IT consulting, and technical training.

We are committed to empowering organizations of all sizes and industries by leveraging modern technologies to help them achieve their strategic and operational goals. Our team of skilled software engineers, database specialists, and technology consultants works closely with clients to understand their unique requirements and deliver high-quality, tailored solutions that exceed expectations.

At Al Hawa Technologies, we believe technology is most effective when aligned with business strategy. Therefore, in addition to development services, we offer expert consulting to optimize processes and improve efficiency. Our long-term client relationships are built on trust, transparency, and a shared commitment to success.

Job Summary

Alhawa Group Company is seeking motivated and proactive interns to join the Sales & Marketing team. The intern will assist in executing sales and marketing activities, engaging with clients, supporting content creation, and gaining hands-on experience in practical sales and marketing operations. This internship offers a dynamic learning environment and the opportunity to develop professional skills for a potential future career in sales and marketing.

Duties & Responsibilities




Assist in implementing and executing sales and marketing strategies.
Support the promotion and presentation of company products and services.
Communicate with clients and follow up on sales inquiries.
Participate in creating and publishing marketing content on various platforms.

Collaborate effectively with the Sales & Marketing team and other departments.
Learn practical skills in sales, marketing, and customer relationship management.

title: Marketing Intern
description:
About Behtar LTD (Behtar Group)

Behtar is a group of companies that has been at the forefront of the telecommunications, mobile money, and e-commerce sectors for 20 years. The company was founded with the vision of connecting people and businesses and facilitating commerce in an increasingly connected world. Through the years, Behtar has grown to become a leading provider of telecommunications, mobile money, and e-commerce services in Afghanistan, with a strong reputation for innovation and customer service. Started as a small telecom service provider and quickly recognized the potential for growth and expansion in the financial services sector. We worked hard to provide innovative and cutting-edge solutions that could improve the lives of our customers. We were the first to offer high-speed internet and mobile banking services in our country, and as a result, we rapidly grew our customer base. With the passage of time, we continued to adapt and evolve to meet the changing needs of our customers, always looking for ways to push the boundaries of what was possible.

Today, the Behtar group of companies is a well-established and respected player in both the telecom and financial services sectors, known for our commitment to excellence and our ability to deliver results. We are excited to continue growing and serving our customers for many years to come.

Job Summary

The Marketing Intern will support market expansion by visiting local markets and onboarding retailers and businesses into the company system. The role is primarily field-based, focused on identifying, engaging, and registering shops and service providers through a structured routing plan. Basic office work is also required for data entry and system updates.

¬†

‚óè¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Refine, correct, and update business and product data

‚óè¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Upload products and services into the platform

‚óè¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Coordinate with the marketing and operations team for follow-up actions

Required Skills & Qualifications

title: Procurement & Operations Specialist (Remote - New Opening)
description:
About COMSIS SOLUTIONS LLC




COMSIS Solutions is a U.S.-based company located in Alexandria, Virginia. Since 2014, we have been providing advanced technology, cybersecurity, artificial intelligence, and logistics solutions. We work closely with U.S. Government agencies and ensure all our projects comply fully with FAR/DFARS regulations.

Our focus is on quality, compliance, on-time delivery, and transparency. COMSIS offers a professional and collaborative work environment that values integrity, teamwork, and growth. We provide excellent opportunities for learning, career development, and innovation.

Job Summary

We are seeking a highly motivated and independent Procurement & Operations Specialist to manage th e end-to-end procurement process for cur company. This role involves sourcing, negotiating, purchasing. vendor management, and resolving issues as they arise. You will work remotely and independently, often on-demand, to support different contracts and global supply chain need.

Duties & Responsibilities

Handle the complete procurement lifecycle from sourcing to purchasing.

Negotiate pricing, terms, and lead times with vendors and supplier.

Request and collect quotations from vendors via phone and email.

Place purchase orders and track deliveries.

Prepare and manage invoices, documentation, and compliance paperwork.

Resolve issues with vendors, logistics, or product availability.

Ensure timely procurement based on project deadlines.

Perform multitasking and versatile duties to support operations as needed.

Communicate directly with the management team regarding procurement status.

Maintain organized records of purchases, contracts, and supplier communications.

Job Requirements

Proven experience in procurement, purchasing, or vendor management.

Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.

Ability to negotiate effectively and close deals.

Must be highly independent, proactive, and able to work without supervision.

Flexible availability (not fixed to standard 9-5 hours).

Reliable laptop/computer and stable high-speed internet connection.

Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.

Fast learner with a problem-solving mindset.

Comfortable with remote work and taking full responsibility for tasks.

Fluent in English.

Knowledge and skills in IT to work with digital systems and toolsz.

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or a related field is required.

title: Datacom & IP Network Presales Specialist
description:
About AWAN Distribution FZC

Awan started in 2010, in Egypt and Pakistan as a philanthropic undertaking with a team of IT professionals recognizing the value of People as the key asset and ultimate objective of any enterprise.

Extending the same concept to the distribution arena, the same team, with a profound knowledge, establishes Awan distribution and understanding of what makes Distribution an added value in deeds & not just words.

Between them, the founding team members have decades of IT distribution knowledge and have already established more than ten full -fledged distribution subsidiaries.

Job Summary

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Datacom & IP Network Presales Specialist to join our team at AWAN Distribution. As a key member of our presales department, you will be responsible for understanding customer requirements, designing innovative IP network solutions, and providing technical expertise and support throughout the presales process. You will collaborate closely with our sales team to deliver tailored solutions that meet our customers' needs and drive business growth.

Duties & Responsibilities

Collaborate with sales teams to identify customer requirements and propose customized IP network solutions.

¬∑ Conduct in-depth technical discussions and presentations to articulate the features and benefits of Huawei IP networking products and solutions.

¬∑ Design and architect IP network solutions based on customer needs, incorporating Huawei's cutting-edge technologies and best practices.

¬∑ Develop detailed network diagrams, proposals, and documentation to support presales activities.

¬∑ Perform product demonstrations and proof of concepts (PoCs) to showcase the capabilities of Huawei IP networking solutions.

¬∑ Provide technical support and guidance to customers during the evaluation and decision-making process.

¬∑ Collaborate with Huawei's product development and engineering teams to address customer feedback and enhance our IP networking offerings.

¬∑ Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and competitive landscape to maintain a competitive edge in the market.




Skills

¬∑ Proven work experience in Datacom Presales

¬∑ Excellent technical skills

¬∑ Excellent written and spoken communication skills

¬∑ Strong problem-solving abilities

¬∑ The ability to work in a team

¬∑ Enthusiasm for your own professional development

Job Requirements

¬∑ Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. Master's degree preferred.

¬∑ 3+ years of experience in presales engineering, solution architecture, or network engineering roles, with a focus on IP networking.

¬∑ In-depth understanding of IP networking principles, protocols, and technologies, including routing, switching, security, and QoS.

¬∑ Hands-on experience with Huawei IP networking products and solutions is highly desirable.

¬∑ Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.

¬∑ Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to identifying and addressing customer challenges.

¬∑ Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple priorities and deadlines effectively.

¬∑ Industry certifications such as CCNP, CCIE, HCNP, or HCIE .

¬∑ Willingness to travel occasionally for customer meetings, workshops, and events.

title: Senior Full Stack Developer (Re - Announced)
description:
About Afghan Wireless Communication Company

Afghan Wireless is Afghanistan‚Äôs first wireless communications company. When we began operations in 2002, we founded Afghanistan‚Äôs mobile communications industry by being the first enterprise to offer cell phone service to Afghan consumers and businesses. For well over a decade, Afghan Wireless has driven the rapid growth of our nation‚Äôs communications market, through its innovative development and deployment of global-class High-Definition (HD) Voice Communications, Internet, Data and Mobile Payments Services. More than 6,000 people work for Afghan Wireless, and our Company is directly responsible for the creation of 100,000 jobs throughout Afghanistan.

Job Summary

We are seeking a Senior Full-Stack Developer with deep expertise in PHP/Laravel, Node.js, and Python to design, develop, and maintain large-scale telecom applications and subscriber-facing platforms. This role involves building high-performance backend systems, customer portals, internal operational tools, and integrating with a wide range of telecom network elements. The ideal candidate has experience working in a Mobile Network Operator (MNO) or large ISP environment, where reliability, security, scalability, and low latency are critical.¬†

Duties & Responsibilities

Design and develop systems such as SIM activation platforms, recharge/payment systems, VAS platforms, subscriber management tools, and operational dashboards.
Build APIs and services that integrate with core telecom systems such as HLR/HSS, OCS/IN, SMSC, PCRF, and provisioning systems.¬†
Build scalable backend applications using Laravel, Node.js, and Python.
Develop high-performance REST/GraphQL APIs and background workers.
Implement queue-based processing using RabbitMQ/Kafka/SQS.
Design database schemas optimized for telecom workloads.
Build dashboards, admin portals, and subscriber interfaces using React, Vue.js, or Next.js.
Implement real-time data interfaces using WebSockets/SSE.¬†
Integrate with telecom systems using REST, SOAP, SMPP, Diameter, and secured API gateways.
Work with both legacy and modern architecture.
Contribute to microservices design and high-availability distributed architectures.
Implement caching, sharding, throttling, and performance techniques.
Containerize and deploy applications using Docker and CI/CD pipelines.
Implement structured logging, tracing (OpenTelemetry), and metrics (Prometheus).¬†
Enforce secure coding practices (OWASP/CIS).
Ensure regulator-compliant audit trails and access control policies.
Mentor team members and perform code reviews.
Work closely with core network, BSS/OSS, NOC/SOC, and cybersecurity teams.

Job Requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Telecom Engineering, or equivalent experience. (Master's degree will be preferred)
Must have 3 to 4 years relevant work experience (2 years‚Äô experience for a master's degree).
Fluent in one of the local languages (Dari, Pashto) and English (written and spoken).
Strong expertise in PHP/Laravel, Node.js, and Python frameworks.
Frontend experience with React/Vue.js/Next.js.
Strong SQL (MySQL/PostgreSQL) and Redis experience.
Experience building high-throughput, telecom-grade applications.
Knowledge of microservices, Docker, CI/CD, and secure API design.¬†
Experience with Kafka/RabbitMQ, SMPP, or CDR/billing systems.
Cloud experience (AWS/Azure/GCP).
Familiarity with TM Forum Open APIs.¬†
Strong work ethic, dependability, and the ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.
Demonstrated ability to lead and inspire a team to achieve goals and deliver high-quality results.
Ability to adapt to changing circumstances and lead the team through transitions and challenges effectively.
Understand the tools, equipment, and procedures specific to the job role.
Ability to work under pressure.
Good communication and interpersonal skills.
Able to travel to other provinces and work extra hours.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills to address and resolve complex issues.
Follow the company's rules and policies.

title: Senior Full Stack Developer (Reannounced)
description:
About Aurum Afghanistan Financial Company

Aurum Afghanistan Financial Company is a full-fledged electronic money institution regulated by the central bank of Afghanistan operating under the license No. EMI101006. In addition to our regulatory license, we are also equipped with license No. 78895 from the Ministry of industry and commerce of Afghanistan. We possess advanced technology infrastructure which enables our clients to access financial services through their mobile phones securely, quickly and conveniently. Our services are available to everyone, particularly individuals who may not have access to traditional banking services. We offer significant opportunities for improving the efficiency of digital financial services by expanding access and lowering transaction costs. We provide a customized electronic payment solution. Aurum Afghanistan facilitates digital financial transactions, which includes services such as mobile wallet to mobile wallet, bank 02 to mobile wallet, mobile wallet to bank, electricity and other utilities bill payments, merchant‚Äôs payments, AfPay card services, payments through PoS machines and other prospective electronic payments services.

Job Summary

The Senior Full Stack Developer at AURUM is responsible for designing, building, and launching software, FinTech solutions, and API integrations. This person leads the Innovation and Development Unit and works to connect AURUM‚Äôs systems with third-party services like mobile operators, e-money providers and digital wallets. The role focuses on creating secure, scalable, and easy-to-use digital services that support AURUM‚Äôs digital goals and customer needs.

Duties & Responsibilities

1. Digital Innovation & Product Development

Manage internal FinTech projects like mobile apps, websites, digital wallets, and automation tools.
Suggest and test new features to improve service quality and user experience.

2. Software Development & Quality Control

Oversee the complete software development process using tools:
Frontend: Angular, or React.
Backend: Java, Spring Boot and relevant libraries
Ensure all software meets high standards for security, performance, and compliance.
Supervise testing (UAT), system launches, and update schedules.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Design and optimize databases (Oracle) to support applications and ensure data integrity.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Write efficient queries and manage database migrations.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Ensure the ongoing development and enhancement of the existing AurumPay Mobile Money system.

3. API Development & Third-Party Integration

Lead the creation of APIs (REST and SOAP) for both internal and external use.
Manage connections with mobile operators, digital wallets, EMIs, and external service providers.
Maintain proper documentation and manage the full API lifecycle.

4. System Design & Infrastructure Planning

Design technical systems and integration plans based on business needs.
Work with teams across the organization to build scalable, efficient solutions.
Ensure all systems connect properly with payment switches and gateways.

5. Team Leadership & Technical Support

Understand the needs of different departments and offer secure, reliable solutions.
Provide training and guidance to technical team members.
Promote and enforce agile development methods across the team.




Job Requirements

Strong knowledge of programming languages: Java, Spring Boot and relevant framework and libraries.
Experience designing system architecture and working with APIs (REST/SOAP) and third-party services.
Familiar with microservices and the full software development lifecycle (SDLC).
Hands-on experience integrating with wallets, telecom operators, EMIs, and financial switches.
Comfortable working with Oracle databases.
Responsible for deploying applications on Oracle WebLogic Server
Skilled in using version control tools such as GitHub and GitLab.
Good documentation and presentation skills.

At least 2 years of experience in FinTech, software development, or technical integration.

title: Web Application Developer
description:
About Afghanistan International Bank

From its inception in 2004, AIB‚Äôs mission has been to foster economic development in the country, be a catalyst for growth, and ultimately contribute to the prosperity of Afghanistan and its people. Afghanistan International Bank is the country‚Äôs leading bank, and one of the most trusted and respected institutions in Afghanistan. Our success has been enabled by our unwavering focus on international best practices in corporate governance, financial, and risk management - including anti-money laundering and ‚Äòknow your customer‚Äô procedures. This is overlaid by industry-leading customer service, operations, information technology, and internal controls. Despite the challenging backdrop over the last decade, we have successfully become a positive emblem for achievement, governance, and transformation. Now in our second decade of operation, we remain committed to enabling a better future for Afghanistan and we are proud to play a role in shaping the opportunities that lie ahead. AIB believes in developing its people through continuous investment in training and giving larger opportunities to those who grow with the bank. Yama Ramin Media Production and Technology Company (YRMPT) is a well-established media production and technology company, officially registered with the Ministry of Commerce and Industries of Afghanistan. With a strong presence across the country, YRMPT delivers innovative media and technology solutions in collaboration with a diverse range of national and international organizations.

We work closely with leading telecom operators, as well as international NGOs, development partners, and humanitarian organizations, and various United Nations agencies. Our projects span media production, digital solutions, communication campaigns, and technology-driven services, contributing to impactful and sustainable initiatives nationwide.

At YRMPT, we value professionalism, creativity, innovation, and teamwork. We provide a dynamic working environment that encourages learning, skill development, and growth, while offering opportunities to work on high-impact projects with reputable local and international partners.

title: Digital Financial Services (DFS) Trainer
description:
About Behtar LTD (Behtar Group)

Behtar is a group of companies that has been at the forefront of the telecommunications, mobile money, and e-commerce sectors for 20 years. The company was founded with the vision of connecting people and businesses, and facilitating commerce in an increasingly connected world. Through the years, Behtar has grown to become a leading provider of telecommunications, mobile money, and e-commerce services in Afghanistan, with a strong reputation for innovation and customer service. Started as a small telecom service provider and quickly recognized the potential for growth and expansion in the financial services sector. we worked hard to provide innovative and cutting-edge solutions that could improve the lives of our customers. We were the first to offer high-speed internet and mobile banking services in our country, and as a result, we rapidly grew our customer base. With the passage of time, we continued to adapt and evolve to meet the changing needs of our customers, always looking for ways to push the boundaries of what was possible.

Today, the Behtar group of companies is a well-established and respected player in both the telecom and financial services sectors, known for our commitment to excellence and our ability to deliver results. We are excited to continue growing and serving our customers for many years to come.

Job Summary

The Digital Financial Services (DFS) Trainer will be responsible for designing and delivering structured capacity-building programs across Behtar Group‚Äôs operational footprint. The role focuses on strengthening agent, merchant, and customer onboarding; improving field performance; and ensuring strict compliance with EMI, telecom, and partner regulatory frameworks. The DFS Trainer will also lead market activation initiatives through workshops and seminars targeting local traders and SMEs to drive adoption and usage of Behtar Group‚Äôs digital financial services.¬†

Duties & Responsibilities

Design, develop, and implement DFS training curricula covering:

Agent and merchant onboarding processes
Customer acquisition and lifecycle management
Float management, transaction workflows, and reconciliation
Performance management and KPI tracking

Deliver classroom, workshop, and field-based trainings for:

Internal staff
Agents and sub-agents
Merchants, shopkeepers, and local traders

Conduct capacity-building sessions at Behtar Group facilities and regional locations through structured workshops and seminars.

Ensure all trainings align with:

EMI operational policies
Telecom and mobile money regulations
Partner banks, MNOs, and third-party compliance requirements

Train field teams and customers on:

KYC, AML/CFT, consumer protection, and fraud prevention
Data security, transaction integrity, and operational risk controls

Support agent and merchant performance optimization through refresher trainings and coaching programs.

Coordinate with Operations, Compliance, Risk, and Business Development teams to ensure consistent messaging and operational adherence.

Prepare training materials, SOPs, user guides, and assessment tools using industry best practices.

Monitor training effectiveness and provide reports with recommendations for continuous improvement.

Job Requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Finance, ICT, Telecommunications, or a related field.

Minimum 3‚Äì5 years of experience in:

Digital Financial Services
EMI, mobile money, or telecom value-added services
Training, capacity building, or field operations

Strong understanding of:

Agent and merchant network management
Mobile money ecosystems and DFS products
Regulatory compliance within EMI and telecom environments

Proven experience delivering training to diverse audiences, including low-literacy market segments.

Excellent communication, facilitation, and stakeholder engagement skills.

Willingness to travel extensively to regional and provincial locations.




Preferred Competencies

Experience working with banks, MNOs, and international development or financial inclusion programs
Strong presentation and instructional design skills
Fluency in local languages and English (written and spoken)

kbl.hr@behtar.com.af

EnvoRail is a Canada based software engineering company in the early stages of building internal platforms and applications. We work across backend systems, web technologies, and mobile apps, with a focus on clean architecture and practical engineering decisions.




We are currently assembling our core technical team.

title: Procurement & Project Solutions Specialist (COO Support | Remote | High-Responsiveness / On-Call)
description:
About VASTGLOBE LOGISTICS LLC

VastGlobe Logistics LLC is a procurement and logistics company that sources and delivers equipment worldwide. We handle the full process, from identifying the right products and securing pricing to documentation, order tracking, and final delivery.




Job Summary

We‚Äôre looking for a highly dedicated, full-scope operations + procurement all-rounder who can support the COO and keep projects moving end-to-end.




1) Online Purchasing + Procurement Execution
Purchase project requirements online (fast + accurate).
Negotiate discounts with vendors (high sales/closing mindset).
Handle tax-exempt purchasing when applicable (collect docs, apply exemption, track status).
Track each purchase from quote ‚Üí order ‚Üí delivery ‚Üí invoice ‚Üí payment status.
Maintain clean records (POs, invoices, receipts, tracking numbers, vendor notes).
2) Discount & Vendor Negotiation (Sales Skills)
Call/email vendors to secure better pricing, faster lead times, and improved terms.
Follow up aggressively and professionally until results are delivered.
3) Project Problem-Solving + Updates
When a project has a problem, you find solutions (research + vendor coordination + internal coordination).
Provide periodic project updates (status, risks, next steps, blockers, resolution plan).
4) COO Assistant (High Research / Due Diligence)
Handle tasks assigned by the COO with strong research, critical thinking, and attention to detail.
Support decision-making with clear findings and recommendations.

5) Payroll & Monthly Employee Reporting.




Work Style Requirements
Fluent English (10/10) spoken and written.
Extremely organized, fast learner, proactive, and accountable.
Highly responsive and available for urgent items when needed (projects can be time-sensitive).







Duties & Responsibilities

Execute end-to-end online purchasing for active projects (quote ‚Üí discount ‚Üí order ‚Üí tracking ‚Üí delivery confirmation ‚Üí invoice filing).

Proactively negotiate vendor discounts via email/phone (pricing, lead time, terms) and follow up until confirmed in writing.

Manage tax-exempt purchasing workflows when applicable (collect exemption docs, submit to vendors, verify tax removal, keep records).

Maintain accurate project purchasing trackers (vendor, item, price, ETA, tracking number, invoice status, issues/notes).

Verify purchase details before ordering (specs, quantities, ship-to, compliance requirements) to avoid errors and delays.

Collect and organize all procurement documentation (quotes, invoices, receipts, packing lists, PODs) in structured folders.

Act as the project problem-solver: identify issues, research solutions, contact vendors/partners, and propose the best fix.

Provide periodic project updates (status, blockers, risks, mitigation plan, next steps) to the COO.

Coordinate with internal team members and vendors to keep each project moving and close out tasks on time.

Prepare monthly employee attendance/salary support reports (days worked, off days, performance/output summary).

Support COO with due diligence and research tasks (vendor research, product alternatives, market pricing, compliance checks).

Maintain strict confidentiality, professionalism, and rapid response for time-sensitive requests.

Job Requirements

Must-Have
Proven experience in procurement / purchasing (online purchasing, vendor coordination, quotes, invoices, order tracking).
Strong ability to solve project problems independently (critical thinking + high ownership).
Excellent vendor negotiation skills (comfortable calling vendors, pushing for discounts, documenting results).
Fluent English (10/10) written and spoken (must communicate clearly with U.S. vendors and clients).
Strong organization and reporting skills (trackers, folders, documentation discipline, monthly reporting).
Reliable home computer setup + stable 24/7 internet access.
High responsiveness, accountability, and ability to work under pressure with deadlines.
Able to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects at once.
Preferred
Bachelor‚Äôs degree (CS preferred) or equivalent experience demonstrating strong analytical skills.
Experience supporting an executive/COO directly.
Familiarity with tools like Google Sheets/Excel, Google Drive, Slack, Trello/Asana/ClickUp.
Experience handling tax exemption certificates and vendor onboarding processes.
Prior experience in logistics/procurement for government or B2B projects is a plus.




Submission Guideline

Please submit a 3-minute video by uploading it to Google Drive and sharing access with ksafi@comsissolutions.com

. Make sure you provide the Google Drive link and grant viewing permission.

In the video, please explain your background in English and confirm that you have 24/7 internet access and a home computer setup. Also, let us know if you are currently working anywhere else.

title: IT Security Analyst
description:
About Ghazanfar Bank

Ghazanfar Bank, a full-fledged licensed commercial Bank, commenced its operations in March 2009. The Share Holders of the Bank belongs to one of the leading business groups of Afghanistan. As a leading business house Ghazanfar Group is involved in various key businesses sectors as a front runner such as import and distribution of Petroleum/Gas and other various important industrial sectors. Ghazanfar Bank started its operation in Kabul, Afghanistan, and is offering key financial services both under conventional and Islamic Banking. The Bank has since opened up its Branches at various key locations such as Mazar Sharif, Hairatan, Nayeb Abad Branch Kunduz, Takhar, Pule- Khumri, Jalalabad, Herat & Kandahar besides opening another eight branches at Kabul in Sarai Shahzada, Shar-e-Naw, Karte Naw, Kote Sangi, Lase Maryam, Karte Char, Kabul Airport Branch and Wazir Akbar Khan. In due course of time, the Bank intends to expand its Branch Network in Kabul as well as at other key locations of the Country.

Job Summary

The IT Security Analyst is responsible for protecting the Bank‚Äôs information assets, systems, and infrastructure by implementing, monitoring, and enhancing information security controls. The role ensures that cybersecurity risks are effectively identified, managed, and escalated in line with Basel principles, regulatory requirements, and the Bank‚Äôs risk appetite.

The position supports operational IT security under the Dy-CIO while ensuring indepndent risk oversight and incident escalation to the CRO

Duties & Responsibilities

A. Information Security Operations

Monitor IT systems, networks, and applications for security threats and vulnerabilities.
Implement and maintain security controls, tools, and configurations.
Support secure system configurations across CBS, applications, servers, and networks.
Ensure compliance with approved IT security standards and policies.




B. Cyber Risk & Incident Management

Detect, analyze, and respond to information security incidents and cyber threats.
Escalate material security incidents, cyber risks, and control weaknesses to the CRO in a timely manner.
Support incident investigation, root-cause analysis, and remediation actions.
Maintain incident logs and prepare incident reports.




C. Governance, Risk & Compliance Support

Support the implementation of the Bank‚Äôs Information Security Policy, IT governance framework, and risk controls.
Coordinate with Risk Management to:
Identify IT and cyber risks
Support risk assessments and KRIs
Align controls with the Bank‚Äôs risk appetite
Support Compliance requirements related to data protection, access controls, and regulatory expectations.




D. Access Control & Security Monitoring

title: Chief Technology Officer
description:
About Ghazanfar Pay

Ghazanfar Pay is establish as a newly Electronic Money Institution (EMI) and a proud subsidiary of Ghazanfar Bank, one of Afghanistan‚Äôs leading and most trusted financial institutions, built on a vision to revolutionize the way people transfer and manage money, Ghazanfar Pay aims to become the leading digital financial services provider in Afghanistan and the region. The company is committed to financial inclusion, bringing secure, affordable, and innovative electronic payment solutions to individuals, businesses, and communities. As a forward-looking financial technology company, Ghazanfar Pay will play a vital role in driving digital transformation in Afghanistan‚Äôs financial sector, promoting trust, transparency, and accessibility for all.

Job Summary

The CTO is responsible for defining and executing Ghazanfar Pay‚Äôs overall technology vision and architecture. This includes oversight of the EMI platform, mobile applications, switching and integration layers, cybersecurity frameworks, data management, and technology operations. The CTO will ensure that Ghazanfar Pay‚Äôs technology infrastructure is secure, scalable, interoperable, and compliant with EMI regulations and industry best practices. The role is critical in enabling product innovation, transaction reliability, operational resilience, and business continuity in a fragile and high-risk operating environment.

Duties & Responsibilities

Technology Strategy & Architecture

Develop and execute the overall technology strategy aligned with Ghazanfar Pay‚Äôs business objectives and regulatory requirements.
Design and maintain enterprise architecture covering Ghazanfar pay platforms, mobile applications, middleware, switching, APIs, and data layers.
Ensure scalability, modularity, and high availability of all technology systems.
Lead technology roadmaps for new product enablement, system upgrades, and digital transformation initiatives.
Ensure interoperability with national payment systems, APS, switches, telecom partners, and banking platforms.
Establish technology governance frameworks, standards, and documentation.

Core Platforms & Application Management

Oversee implementation, configuration, and lifecycle management of Ghazanfar pay systems, wallet platforms, and transaction engines.
Ensure stability, performance, and resilience of mobile apps, portals, and backend services.
Lead integration of merchant systems, agent platforms, billers, and third-party fintech solutions.
Manage change management, version upgrades, and release cycles.
Ensure strong QA, UAT, and production deployment processes.
Support rapid and secure rollout of new digital products and features.

Cybersecurity, Infrastructure & Data Protection

Establish and enforce comprehensive cybersecurity frameworks aligned with regulatory and international standards.
Oversee security architecture, access controls, encryption, network protection, and endpoint security.
Lead implementation of SOC monitoring, vulnerability management, and incident response mechanisms.
Ensure compliance with data protection, privacy, and consumer information security requirements.
Conduct regular penetration testing, system audits, and disaster recovery drills.
Develop and maintain business continuity and disaster recovery systems.

Systems Operations & Reliability

Ensure 24/7 system availability, monitoring, and performance optimization.
Oversee transaction processing efficiency, uptime management, and system health dashboards.
Establish SLAs and performance frameworks for internal systems and third-party vendors.
Implement automated monitoring, alerting, and failover mechanisms.
Lead root cause analysis and continuous system improvement initiatives.
Ensure operational readiness for high transaction volumes and national-scale services.

Vendor, Integration & Innovation Management

Lead technology vendor selection, contracting, performance monitoring, and risk assessments.
Manage system integrators, cloud/service providers, telecom partners, and fintech collaborators.
Oversee API ecosystems and secure partner connectivity frameworks.
Identify emerging technologies to enhance efficiency, security, and service delivery.
Promote innovation in payments, AI-enabled operations, digital identity, and analytics.
Ensure cost-effective, future-proof technology investments.

Regulatory, Risk & Compliance Enablement

Work closely with Compliance, Risk, and Internal Audit to embed regulatory controls into system design.
Ensure platforms support AML/CFT monitoring, transaction surveillance, and regulatory reporting.
Facilitate system readiness for Central Bank inspections and audits.
Maintain documentation of system controls, data flows, and security governance.
Ensure traceability, audit logs, and regulatory reporting capabilities are fully embedded.

Data, Analytics & Digital Enablement

Lead data architecture, warehousing, and analytics platforms.
Enable real-time dashboards for management, operations, compliance, and risk monitoring.
Promote data-driven decision-making and customer insight capabilities.
Oversee AI, automation, and digital optimization initiatives.
Ensure data quality, availability, and integrity across systems.

People, Capability & Performance Management

Build, lead, and mentor a high-performing technology and digital team.
Establish continuous learning and certification programs.
Define clear KPIs, performance dashboards, and service accountability frameworks.
Promote a culture of innovation, resilience, cybersecurity awareness, and operational discipline.
Ensure succession planning and local capacity development.
Enforce ethical, professional, and secure technology practices.

Job Requirements

Education

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field (Master‚Äôs preferred).
Professional certifications such as CISSP, CISM, TOGAF, ITIL, or cloud/security certifications highly desirable.

Experience

Minimum 8‚Äì10 years of experience in technology leadership roles within EMI, fintech, telecom, banking, or payment services.
At least 3‚Äì5 years in a senior management or CTO/Head of Technology role.
Proven experience implementing large-scale digital payment platforms and high-availability systems.
Strong expertise in cybersecurity, systems integration, APIs, and payment switching.
Demonstrated experience working with regulators, audits, and compliance-driven environments.
Strong understanding of mobile money ecosystems, EMI platforms, and digital financial infrastructure.
Experience in emerging markets or fragile operating environments preferred.
Fluency in English required; local languages an asset.
Experience supporting humanitarian or large-scale digital payment programs is a strong advantage.

Key Competencies

Strategic technology leadership and execution capability.
Strong systems architecture and cybersecurity expertise.
Operational resilience and crisis management skills.
Innovation mindset with strong delivery discipline.
Vendor and stakeholder management capability.
High integrity, accountability, and regulatory awareness.
Strong problem-solving and analytical thinking.
Ability to operate in high-risk, fast-changing environments.
Expertise in interoperability and national payment infrastructure.
Commitment to building sustainable local technology capacity.

title: Sharia Audit Officer
description:
About Ghazanfar Bank

Ghazanfar Bank, a full-fledged licensed commercial Bank, commenced its operations in March 2009. The Share Holders of the Bank belongs to one of the leading business groups of Afghanistan. As a leading business house Ghazanfar Group is involved in various key businesses sectors as a front runner such as import and distribution of Petroleum/Gas and other various important industrial sectors. Ghazanfar Bank started its operation in Kabul, Afghanistan, and is offering key financial services both under conventional and Islamic Banking. The Bank has since opened up its Branches at various key locations such as Mazar Sharif, Hairatan, Nayeb Abad Branch, Kunduz, Takhar, Pule- Khumri, Jalalabad, Herat, Kandahar, Faryab besides opening another Nine branches at Kabul in Sarai Shahzada, Shar-e-Naw, Karte Naw, Kote Sangi, Lase Maryam, Karte Char, Kabul Airport Branch and Wazir Akbar Khan. In due course of time, the Bank intends to expand its Branch Network in Kabul as well as at other key locations of the Country.

¬†

Job Summary

The Sharia Audit Officer is responsible for conducting periodic Sharia audits across the bank to ensure all products, services, contracts, transactions, and operational processes fully comply with Islamic Sharia principles and the rulings of the Sharia Supervisory Board. The role helps preserve the bank‚Äôs Islamic integrity and strengthens governance.

Duties & Responsibilities

1. Sharia Audit Planning & Execution

Participate in preparing the annual Sharia Audit Plan based on risk assessment.
Conduct field audits in branches and departments to verify adherence to Sharia guidelines.
Examine financing files, contracts, documentation, and transaction flows for Sharia compliance.
Test samples of Murabaha, Ijara, Musharaka, Mudaraba, and deposit transactions against Sharia standards.

2. Review of Contracts, Policies & Procedures

Audit the implementation of Sharia-approved product structures and documentation.
Ensure operational procedures match the product manuals approved by the Sharia Supervisory Board (SSB).
Check whether staff are following required Sharia workflows (e.g., asset ownership, agency structures, disclosures, penalties handling).

3. Identification of Sharia Non-Compliance

Identify Sharia violations, deviations, or gaps during audits.
Discuss findings with relevant departments and agree on corrective actions.
Ensure non-compliance events are recorded, reported, and resolved within the required timeframe.

4. Reporting & Documentation

Prepare clear Sharia audit reports with observations, recommendations, and compliance ratings.
Submit audit results to the Head of Sharia Audit and contribute to reports for the Sharia Supervisory Board.
Maintain proper documentation of all audit working papers and evidence.

5. Follow-Up & Corrective Actions

Follow up on previously reported Sharia findings to verify whether corrective actions were implemented.
Work with business units, risk management, operations, and compliance teams to close audit issues.

6. Coordination & Support

Coordinate with Internal Audit and Compliance Department for combined risk reviews.
Provide Sharia guidance to departments during audits to improve their understanding and performance.

7. Capacity Building & Awareness

Support the development of Sharia audit tools, checklists, and audit methodologies.
Assist in internal awareness sessions on Sharia compliance requirements for staff.

8. Continuous Improvement

Stay updated on AAOIFI Sharia standards, new fatwas, and industry best practices.

. Recommend improvements to Sharia audit processes and internal controls

Job Requirements

Qualifications & Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Islamic Studies, Sharia, Islamic Finance, Accounting, or Business Administration.
Professional certification in Islamic finance or Sharia audit (preferred).
1‚Äì3 years of experience in Islamic banking, Sharia audit, internal audit, or compliance roles.
Familiarity with AAOIFI standards and Islamic banking products.

Skills & Competencies

Strong understanding of Islamic banking and Sharia principles.
Ability to analyze financial transactions and documentation.
Good report writing skills with clarity and accuracy.
Strong attention to detail and analytical mindset.
Excellent communication and coordination abilities.
High integrity, objectivity, and professionalism.

Al Hawa Technologies is a dynamic and forward-thinking information technology company providing a comprehensive range of professional services, including custom software development, database design and implementation, IT consulting, and technical training.

We are committed to empowering organizations of all sizes and industries by leveraging modern technologies to help them achieve their strategic and operational goals. Aurum Afghanistan Financial Company is a full-fledged electronic money institution regulated by the central bank of Afghanistan operating under the license No. EMI101006. In addition to our regulatory license, we are also equipped with license No. 78895 from the Ministry of industry and commerce of Afghanistan. We possess advanced technology infrastructure which enables our clients to access financial services through their mobile phones securely, quickly and conveniently. Our services are available to everyone, particularly individuals who may not have access to traditional banking services. We offer significant opportunities for improving the efficiency of digital financial services by expanding access and lowering transaction costs. We provide a customized electronic payment solution. Aurum Afghanistan facilitates digital financial transactions, which includes services such as mobile wallet to mobile wallet, bank 02 to mobile wallet, mobile wallet to bank, electricity and other utilities bill payments, merchant‚Äôs payments, AfPay card services, payments through PoS machines and other prospective electronic payments services. AurumPay is a leading electronic money platform in Afghanistan, operating under the supervision of the Central Bank of Afghanistan. title: Information Comm. Technology Associate, GS6, Fixed Term, Kandahar (#19484) & Herat (#19391)
description:
About UNICEF Afghanistan

UNICEF works in some of the world‚Äôs toughest places, to reach the world‚Äôs most disadvantaged children. To save their lives. To defend their rights. To help them fulfill their potential. Across 190 countries and territories, we work for every child, everywhere, every day, to build a better world for everyone. And we never give up. For every child, Passion!

Job Summary

How can you make a difference?¬†




Purpose for the job:¬†ICT/T4D Associates will assist programme teams in the identification, assessment and integration of ICT and digital innovation into UNICEF programming; strengthening internal capacity to support T4D related initiatives; identifying and engaging with key partners; building and maintaining business relationships; applying reusable and replicable technical buildings blocks; and maximizing the potential for the scale-up and sustainability of technology and digital innovation for UNICEF programming.







Duties & Responsibilities

Summary of Key function, accountabilities and related duties/tasks

Ôªø

T4D Portfolio Coordination
Minimal ICT Administration

If you would like to know more about this position, please review the complete Job Description here:¬†JD/TOR- ICT Associate G-6




Job Requirements

To qualify as an advocate for every child you will have‚Ä¶




Minimum requirements:

Education:

Completion of Secondary education is required, supplemented with formal training in Computer Science, Information Systems, Telecommunications, Engineering.

Work Experience:

A minimum of six years of practical work experience in information technology, requiring systematic methods of troubleshooting and problem solving is required.
A bachelor‚Äôs degree from a recognized academic institution in a relevant field may replace three years of related work experience. A master‚Äôs degree may replace an additional two years.
ITIL Foundation Certificate or equivalent customer support certification is an asset.¬†
Experience in providing assistance to users with IT products and services, and use of applications and diagnostic tools is required.
Practical experience in providing technical and business Customer Support and Services is required.
Practical experience and working knowledge of various computer platforms and applications are required.

Language Requirements:¬†

Fluency in English is required. Knowledge of another official UN language (Arabic, Chinese, French, Russian or Spanish) or a local language is an asset.

Desirables:

Relevant experience at country level, particularly in development, fragile settings and humanitarian contexts.




Submission Guideline

Remarks:




As per Article 101, paragraph 3, of the Charter of the United Nations, the paramount consideration in the employment of the staff is the necessity of securing the highest standards of efficiency, competence, and integrity.

UNICEF is committed to fostering an inclusive, representative, and welcoming workforce. For this position, eligible and suitable¬†Female¬†candidates¬†are encouraged to apply.

Vacancy announcement is open to internal and external candidates. Priority will be given to staff in abolished posts and internal staff members.

Government employees who are considered for employment with UNICEF are normally required¬†to resign from their government positions before taking up an assignment with UNICEF. UNICEF reserves the right to withdraw an offer of appointment, without compensation, if a visa or medical clearance is not obtained, or necessary inoculation requirements are not met, within a reasonable period for any reason.¬†

UNICEF does not charge a processing fee at any stage of its recruitment, selection, and hiring processes (i.e., application stage, interview stage, validation stage, or appointment and training). UNICEF will not ask for applicants‚Äô bank account information.

Humanitarian action is a cross-cutting priority within UNICEF‚Äôs Strategic Plan. UNICEF is committed to stay and deliver in humanitarian contexts. Therefore, all staff, at all levels across all functional areas, can be called upon to be deployed to support humanitarian response, contributing to both strengthening resilience of communities and capacity of national authorities.

All UNICEF positions are advertised, and only shortlisted candidates will be contacted and advance to the next stage of the selection process. An internal candidate performing at the level of the post in the relevant functional area, or an internal/external candidate in the corresponding Talent Group, may be selected, if suitable for the post, without assessment of other candidates.

Candidates who have applied previously do not need to reapply.




Additional information about working for UNICEF can be found¬†here.




Applicants are requested to apply through the provided link; Vacancies | UNICEF Careers




Applications received via JOBS.AF online portal will not be given consideration.

title: HMIS Data Assistance
description:
About MAGNA

MAGNA¬†is a medical humanitarian organization that has been actively working worldwide and providing humanitarian aid for more than 20 years. Now our projects cover about 15 countries. The largest programs are deployed in¬†Congo (DR), Syria, South Sudan, Iraq, Afghanistan and Ukraine. We implement our humanitarian aid projects by working directly with the medical institutions and supporting doctors provided direct emergency medical care to patients who need it.




MAGNA¬†operates internationally and provides assistance to children and their families in need, including victims of natural disasters, wars and conflicts. In the field we maintain doctors and medical staff but also technical and other specialists, providing humanitarian assistance and help to treat children and their families.




MAGNA¬†focusing on¬†Health, Nutrition and MHPSS¬†projects, primarily aimed at saving lives and alleviating the suffering of those in need. Armed conflicts and unstable political situations have a devastating impact on ordinary people. Consequences, often associated with inadequate local health services, commonly include direct violence, forced displacement, epidemics, famine, and psychological trauma. Providing medical assistance to victims of conflicts and crises is MAGNA workers‚Äô top priority. Alleviating suffering from infectious diseases neglected by local structures is another major area of MAGNA‚Äôs focus.




MAGNA has a zero tolerance policy with regard to Sexual Exploitation and Abuse by MAGNA‚Äôs personnel against the people they serve. Protection from Sexual Exploitation and Abuse (PSEA) is the responsibility of everyone and all selected candidates will be required to comply with MAGNA‚Äôs PSEA Policy at all times. Selected candidates will therefore undergo rigorous reference and background checks against their past behavior related to sexual exploitation and abuse, and may be required to provide additional information further on in the selection process.

Job Summary

Defining, coordinating and monitoring all data related activities including data collection, analysis, reporting, monitoring and evaluation processes according to¬†MAGNA¬†protocols, standards and procedures in order to ensure quality medical care for patients and their communities and to improve the health condition of the population

Duties & Responsibilities

Accountabilities:

-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Data Entry and Monitoring, assist with daily data entry tasks for the health facilities (clinics, hospitals, health centers) and support the establishment of monitoring tools for data collection processes.

-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Data Verification, ensure that all collected data is accurate, consistent, and aligned with the project's indicators. Perform regular checks to ensure the quality and completeness of data.

-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Technical Assistance, provide technical support and guidance to the health care providers and data entry team on how to use HMIS tools for data entry. Help resolve issues related to data collection.

-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Data Analysis Support, assist in analyzing collected data to identify trends, gaps, and key performance indicators (KPIs). Support the review and assessment of data to ensure project targets are being met.

-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Reporting and Feedback, assist in the preparation of monthly and quarterly reports on analyzed data. Provide feedback to the health facilities on the status of their data quality and suggest areas for improvement.

-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Capacity Building Support, assist in identifying and addressing training needs for the health facilities' staff related to HMIS. Participate in on-the-job training sessions to improve skills in data entry, quality control, and analysis.

-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†HR Coordination, support the HR department in monitoring the training and development needs of the data entry staff. Assist in the organization of training or induction programs for new data team members.

-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Support Project Teams, attend regular internal meetings and training sessions, such as MAGNA's coordination meetings and trainings, to contribute to team updates and feedback. Participate in the dissemination of project-related information to the team.

-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Data Update and Communication, ensure that all HMIS data collection tools are updated regularly. Assist in sharing relevant updates with team members and healthcare providers to ensure consistent communication of expectations.

-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Report Preparation, support the preparation and submission of regular data reports to the Ministry of Health (MoPH), donors, and MAGNA. Ensure reports are accurate, complete, and submitted on time.

-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Team Collaboration, work closely with the medical team and health supervisors to ensure proper data collection and entry practices. Participate in collaborative team efforts to assess and improve data handling processes.

-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Additional Tasks, perform any other tasks assigned by the supervisor to support the success of the project, including assisting with other administrative or operational activities as needed




Context Specific Accountabilities:

-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†He will assist with daily data entry tasks for the health facilities (clinics, hospitals, health centers) and support the establishment of monitoring tools for data collection processes.

-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†He will help review and adapt HMIS data collection tools to meet the project‚Äôs needs and indicators, under the guidance of the HMIS Manager.

-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†He will ensure that all HMIS data collection tools are updated regularly. Assist in sharing relevant updates with team members and healthcare providers to ensure consistent communication of expectations.

-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†He will ensure the regular supply of HMIS tools to the health facilities, and he will maintain the supply of HMIS tools on need based to the health facilities.

-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†He will assist in ensuring that all staff follow the HMIS Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for data collection and documentation.

-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†He will assist with the verification and validation of collected data to maintain consistency and quality at all health facility levels.

-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†He will ensure that all collected data is accurate, consistent, and aligned with the project's indicators. Perform regular checks to ensure the quality and completeness of data.

-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†He will help in analyzing key project indicators and comparing collected data with project targets to assess the performance of activities and identify areas for improvement.

-¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†He will ensure that all patient data and sensitive information are handled with full respect and maintained confidentially in accordance with privacy guidelines.

He will perform any other tasks assigned by the supervisor to support the success of the project, including assisting with other administrative or operational activities as needed

Job Requirements

Education

MD/ Nursing degree from recognized institute




Experience

At least 2 years of experience in HMIS and Data entry.

¬†

personal-adm-mng@af.magna.org

No other type of submission will be accepted.




Please mention the vacancy number and position name in the subject line of the email. Otherwise, you will not be shortlisted.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†MAGNA may keep data of your application for its pool of candidate and might propose to you another position than the one you applied for based on your qualification.




Only short-listed candidates whose application responds to the criteria will be contacted & local applicants from the same province are encouraged to apply and will be given priority.¬†

title: Delivery and Service Director
description:
About Huawei Technologies Afghanistan Co, Ltd

Huawei Technologies Afghanistan Co, Ltd is a subsidiary of Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd., a global leader in information and communications technology (ICT) solutions. Established to serve the Afghan market, Huawei Technologies Afghanistan provides advanced ICT products and services, including telecommunications infrastructure, enterprise solutions, and digital power (Huawei‚Äôs Digital Power focuses on integrating digital and power electronics technologies to provide innovative solutions for renewable energy generation, energy storage, and efficient energy management to drive sustainability and carbon neutrality). The company plays a significant role in developing Afghanistan‚Äôs digital ecosystem, partnering with local telecom operators, and enterprises to enhance connectivity, foster innovation, and drive digital transformation. Huawei Technologies Afghanistan focuses on building secure and efficient ICT systems, including mobile networks (2G, 3G, 4G, and 5G), data centers, and cloud computing solutions, tailored to meet the unique needs of the Afghan market. Its operations align with Huawei‚Äôs global vision of enabling digital inclusion and advancing technological progress.)

Job Summary

We are looking for a highly skilled Delivery and Service Director to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in telecom and ICT engineering, along with experience in finance control, internal control, and project group management. This leadership position requires fluency in both Chinese and English and a proven ability to oversee the delivery of services and projects across diverse teams and stakeholders.

Duties & Responsibilities

Oversee the entire lifecycle of delivery and service operations for our telecom and ICT projects.
Manage and lead internal project groups, ensuring timely and cost-effective project delivery.
Ensure compliance with finance control and internal control policies, maintaining financial integrity throughout the projects.
Collaborate with senior leadership to develop and implement operational strategies.
Drive improvements in service delivery processes and customer satisfaction.
Act as the primary point of contact for key clients and stakeholders, ensuring clear communication and alignment with business objectives.
Lead cross-functional teams, providing guidance and mentorship to junior managers and team members.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of industry trends, technologies, and regulatory requirements.
Report on project status, financials, and any risks or issues to the executive team.

Job Requirements

Proven experience in a leadership role within the telecom and ICT industries.
Strong background in finance control, internal control, and project management.
Ability to communicate fluently in both Chinese and English (both written and spoken).
Engineering background in telecommunications or ICT, with a deep understanding of technical delivery and service operations.
Excellent interpersonal and leadership skills, with the ability to manage teams and coordinate across multiple departments.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment.
Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in Telecommunications, Engineering, Automation or a related field.
Experience with international project management or multi-country operations.
Certification in Project Management (e.g., PMP) is a plus.

title: Daily Wage/Enumerator (On & Off)
description:
About Islamic Relief Worldwide

Islamic Relief Worldwide (IRW) is an international, non-profitable, non-governmental humanitarian relief organization with its head quarter in Birmingham, UK. It enjoys consultative status with the Economic and Social Council of the United Nations and is a signatory to the Code of Conduct for International Red Cross and red Crescent Moments and NGOs in Disaster Relief. Islamic Relief has been working in Afghanistan for more than 23 years, providing emergency relief and implementing life-changing development projects for some of the most vulnerable people in the country. Islamic Relief set up our first Afghanistan office in 1999. Since then, IRA continued providing assistances in emergency relief, food security, livelihood, education, health, nutrition, shelter, orphan sponsorship, Ramadan and Qurbani programmes.

Job Summary

The Surveyor/distributor is responsible for the collection of information on assigned tasks by the Humanitarian department of IRW, conducting door-to-door assessment surveys for profiling communities and implementing the distribution interventions assigned by the Humanitarian department of IRW in the targeted locations.

Duties & Responsibilities

¬†Regularly travel to targeted urban and rural areas across cities and districts of the assigned provinces, ensuring timely presence in hard-to-reach and underserved communities.
Conduct accurate, respectful, and timely household-level assessments and door-to-door surveys in close coordination with Community Development Councils (CDCs), village elders, and community representatives, to identify and register vulnerable households in line with approved program criteria.
Engage with community members in a culturally sensitive manner to help identify the most vulnerable groups, including female-headed households, persons with disabilities, elderly-headed households, internally displaced persons (IDPs), and returnees.
Actively support inclusive community engagement by developing practical approaches to reach vulnerable households in remote and rural locations, taking into account security, accessibility, and cultural norms.
Ensure that all selected beneficiaries strictly meet the eligibility criteria and that the selection process is transparent, fair, and free from favoritism or influence.
Accurately register beneficiary and community information and maintain an organized and up-to-date database, ensuring confidentiality and protection of personal data at all times.
Participate in required training, briefings, and refresher sessions related to assessment tools, protection principles, accountability to affected populations (AAP), and data quality.
Immediately report any challenges, risks, community feedback, or protection concerns encountered in the field to the supervisor or relevant team.
Adhere to organizational values, humanitarian principles, safeguarding policies, and local customs while representing the organization professionally in the field.
Perform any other duties assigned by management that support effective program implementation and community engagement.

Job Requirements

Qualification:

12 Grade, Diploma or bachelor‚Äôs degree in social science or any other relevant field is preferable.

Experience:

Minimum of 1‚Äì2 years of relevant experience in data collection, surveys, assessments, or similar field-based work.

Required Skills:

Proven fast and accurate English typing skills with strong data entry experience, particularly using digital data collection tools.
Familiarity with electronic data collection platforms (e.g., KoboToolbox, ODK, CommCare, or similar) is an asset.
Good communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact respectfully with diverse communities.¬†




Submission Guideline

Interested and qualified national candidates should¬†submit¬†a cover letter explaining their motivation and an updated CV to the following link:

Daily Wage/Enumerator (On & Off) | Jobs.af




The closing date for accepting applications is¬†20 January 2026




Please note that applications received after the closing date will not be considered, and only short-listed candidates will be called for written test.




Islamic Relief Worldwide ‚Äì Afghanistan¬†is committed to providing equal employment opportunities and encourages applications from all qualified candidates, including women and persons with disabilities.

title: RAN Back Office Engineer ( Huawei)
description:
About I Engineering Group

ieng Group provides EPC and O&M infrastructure services with a focus on the telecom and power industries. The Group's subsidiaries Eki.Struct (tower) and GreenPole (power), along with its affiliated asset management company CREI complement the functions provided by ieng.

Established in 2007, the Group is a leading provider of telecom infrastructure and managed services in Africa and Emerging Markets.




We have grown rapidly since our inception in 2007 and are now operational in 19 countries: Afghanistan, Algeria, Cameroon, Central African Republic, Chad, DR Congo, Ethiopia, Ghana, Guinea, Kenya, KSA, Lebanon, Liberia, Myanmar, Nigeria, Pakistan, Philippines, South Sudan and Uganda.

Today, we maintain over 31,200+ sites for Africa‚Äôs largest MNOs and all TowerCos.







Our vision¬†To become the leading Engineering Procurement and Construction (EPC) and Operation and Maintenance (O&M) contractor in global emerging markets.







ÔªøOur Mission¬†We provide EPC and O&M services to the telecom, renewable energy and construction industries in global emerging markets, seamlessly integrating our core competencies with our customers‚Äô businesses, so they benefit from competitive and comprehensive solutions.




Job Summary

ieng Afghanistan is seeking highly skilled Huawei experts for RAN to join our team. The ideal candidate must have extensive experience with Huawei networks and equipment. This role involves leading network swap, network planning, optimization, troubleshooting, and maintenance efforts to ensure the highest performance and reliability of network. Attractive package will be offered

Duties & Responsibilities

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Provide Analysis and monitoring Network performance by Checking Key Quality Indicators (KQI's)

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Monitor and demarcating service degradation (Voice and Data) by checking performance of the network nodes

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Knowledge of performance counters of RAN and Core KPI‚Äôs to make sure that all necessary counters are activated for daily, weekly, monthly and critical outages.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Using Big Data analytics to provide trend analysis for KQI/KPI and provide suggestions and solution on performance improvement

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Customer proactive support using signaling call flows and big data analytics to improve Customer experience.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Investigate and analyze individual User complaints for " CS and PS" services, international link's (link utilization, call performance)

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Mapping between KPI's & KQI's that's related to worst cell/Site/Node analysis to assist relevant team in improving network performance.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Detect value added cases by analyzing which KPI affect services.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Reviewing and making guidelines for network performance and people management.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Managing day-to-day Network KPIs and performed required analysis to improve the service delivery

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Review of various reports (Site outage report, KPI reports, Daily CR report, Pending Outage Reports).

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Checking and reviewing of the KPIs and SLA of the TT‚Äôs created by Monitoring team.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Technical review of the work orders change request which are impacting the NOC monitoring.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Providing post incident report and Root cause analysis for Major and Critical Incidents and User complaints.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Expert knowledge of U2020, BSC, RNC, 2G, 3G, LTE/5G technologies and Huawei RAN solutions.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Empower local RAN team to do complex task and train them daily, weekly and monthly basis.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Proven experience in leading large-scale RAN projects and optimization initiatives.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Network deployment and implementation to oversee installation and configuration of RAN components and ensure equipment is step according design and standards.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†Capacity Management to assess network traffic and make sure that each interface has enough capacity to handle peak hours traffic.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†Trouble shooting and Problem Resolution to analyze problem, degradation and other RAN KPIs.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Use available or third parties‚Äô or specialized software tools for network analysis and trouble shooting.

¬†¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†Technology Upgrades and Updates, Ability to migrate from vendor to Vendor and advance wireless technology.

¬†

OH&S/QMS Role and Responsibilities:

¬†

Reports any hazards or risks in addition to Accidents/Incident to QHSE department.
Be aware of and complies to i engineering‚Äôs IMS Policy.
Abides by i engineering‚Äôs Local Legal and Client Requirements.
Attends and engages in IMS Awareness Sessions.
Ensures that all IMS procedures are regularly followed and raises the issue when they are not

description:
About Ministry of Public Health

The Ministry of Public Health (MoPH) is tasked with a critical mandate; to deliver and promote sustainable and accessible health care services to the people of Afghanistan. Social and economic advancement can only be realized in a thriving and healthy society. The success of the MoPH is heavily driven in its ability to plan and use allocated resources effectively. Effective financial management is therefore critical for sustainable development and is the primary tool that translates the MoPH development strategies into noticeable outcomes or service delivery. Good governance and accountability relies on transparent management of the MoPH budget. Therefore, ineffective financial management undermines the effectiveness and efficiency of development interventions and hinders the country‚Äôs progress towards improved and sustainable health care. MoPH finance directorate is going through a reform process and after reviewing the structure of finance directorates of other line ministries such as MRRD, MoE and MAIL, has proposed a new and standard structure that is approved by MoPH leadership, for this purpose MoPH needs a qualified staff as head of coordination and reporting unite, to take the responsibility of overall coordination and financial reporting of MoPH.

title: Branch Manager
description:
About AsrePoya Inc

-

Job Summary

The Branch Manager is responsible for leading and managing all branch operations to ensure efficiency, profitability, and customer satisfaction. This role oversees staff performance, drives business growth, and maintains compliance with company policies and industry regulations. The Branch Manager serves as the primary representative of the branch, fostering strong client relationships, implementing strategic initiatives, and ensuring smooth day-to-day operations. Success in this position requires strong leadership, financial management skills, and the ability to deliver exceptional service while achieving business objectives.

Duties & Responsibilities

Leadership & Team Management

Supervise, mentor, and motivate branch staff to achieve performance targets.
Conduct regular training and performance evaluations.
Foster a positive, customer-focused work environment.

Business Development

Develop and implement strategies to increase branch sales and market share.
Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, partners, and the local community.
Identify new business opportunities and expand customer base.

Operations & Compliance

Ensure smooth day-to-day operations of the branch.
Monitor adherence to company policies, regulatory requirements, and industry standards.
Oversee cash management, security, and audit processes.

Financial Management

Prepare and manage branch budgets, forecasts, and financial reports.
Track revenue, expenses, and profitability.
Implement cost-control measures while maximizing efficiency.

Customer Service

Guarantee high-quality service delivery and customer satisfaction.
Resolve escalated customer issues promptly and effectively.
Promote customer loyalty through personalized service.




Job Requirements

Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science (priority will be given to candidates holding a Master‚Äôs degree).

Languages: Fluency in Dari, Pashto, and English.

Technical Skills: Strong knowledge of computer science concepts and tools.

Managerial Skills: Effective planning, decision-making, and resource management abilities.

Personal Attributes: Leadership qualities, teamwork spirit, and strong communication skills with clients and colleagues.




Note : Applicants holding a Master‚Äôs degree will receive extra points during the evaluation process.¬†







Submission Guideline

Candidates must submit an updated CV/resume along with a cover letter highlighting relevant experience and skills.

Applications should be sent via email to the designated HR address.

All applications must be received before the closing date specified in the job announcement. Late submissions will not be considered.
